cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 360 miles SSE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coastline, then turning north-northwest inland across Louisiana and Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas/Louisiana border close to Cameron, LA (south of Lake Charles)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, LA; Storm-surge watch Freeport TX to San Luis Pass TX and Mouth of Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Storm Surge Warning San Luis Pass TX to Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts, including Calcasieu Lake and the Lake Charles area
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds possible; 64-kt (major hurricane) probability 63% and 50-kt probability 84% at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge 9–14 ft possible in Calcasieu Lake and the surrounding coast, including Lake Charles waterway
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated 15 inches, producing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Tornado threat beginning Wednesday evening; dangerous waves, life-threatening surf and rip currents
